thread.title: LJ Hooker launches pre-initial public offering cash call
thread.title_full: LJ Hooker launches pre-initial public offering cash call | afr.com

author: Post to Linkedin
title: LJ Hooker launches pre-initial public offering cash call
text:
As non-executive deputy chairman Janusz Hooker controls a 10 per cent stake in the franchise group. by Sarah Thompson Anthony Macdonald LJ Hooker, the iconic real estate firm launched by Sir Leslie Hooker in 1928, has commenced a pre-initial public offering funding round, sources told Street Talk.
It's understood the firm is looking to raise about $20 million and will be meeting with institutional and high-net-worth investors in Sydney and Melbourne over the coming weeks.
Citigroup and Morgans is advising on the deal.
Proceeds will be used to make acquisitions and also invest in LJ Hooker franchisees, which in the past year, helped by the strong uplift in the market and an influx of investors, have sold more than $19 billion worth of property and increased the pool of properties under management to about 130,000, worth $75 billion.
The move will also help to pave the way for a float of the business, although sources cautioned an ASX listing would not take place until early 2016.
LJ Hooker is one of the nation's best-known brands. The group has more than 700 franchise offices and 8000 people across Australia and in New Zealand, the Pacific and Asia, along with international partnerships. Beyond the ubiquitous real estate shops the group has a commercial real estate franchise network and, in LJ Hooker Home Loans, a significant mortgage broking operation.
Interestingly, fund managers have been asked to compare LJ Hooker to Realogy Franchise Group, the $US5.5 billion parent company of CENTURY 21, ERA, Coldwell Banker, and Sotheby's International Realty which trades on a forward profit multiple of about 26 times.
LJ Hooker's cash call comes after rival, McGrath Estate Agents, agreed to buy its largest franchisee, the 10 Sydney offices controlled by Shane Smollen. Correctly structured, the purchase should boost McGrath's income, from a fixed franchise fee to a much more substantial company income.
